properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: server_image_product_code
properties.description: (Optional) Server image product code to determine which server image to create. It can be obtained through data ncloud_server_images. You are required to select one among two parameters: server image product code (server_image_product_code) and member server image number(member_server_image_no).

properties.name: server_product_code
properties.description: (Optional) Server product code to determine the server specification to create. It can be obtained through the getServerProductList action. Default : Selected as minimum specification. The minimum standards are 1. memory 2. CPU 3. basic block storage size 4. disk type (NET,LOCAL)

properties.name: member_server_image_no
properties.description: (Optional) Required value when creating a server from a manually created server image. It can be obtained through the getMemberServerImageList action.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Server name to create. default: Assigned by ncloud

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Server description to create

properties.name: login_key_name
properties.description: (Optional) The login key name to encrypt with the public key. Default : Uses the most recently created login key name

properties.name: is_protect_server_termination
properties.description: (Optional) You can set whether or not to protect return when creating. default : false

properties.name: internet_line_type
properties.description: (Optional) Internet line identification code. PUBLC(Public), GLBL(Global). default : PUBLC(Public)

properties.name: fee_system_type_code
properties.description: (Optional) A rate system identification code. There are time plan(MTRAT) and flat rate (FXSUM). Default : Time plan(MTRAT)

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) Zone code. You can determine the ZONE where the server will be created. Default : Assigned by NAVER Cloud Platform. Get available values using the data source ncloud_zones.

properties.name: access_control_group_configuration_no_list
properties.description: (Optional) You can set the ACG created when creating the server. ACG setting number can be obtained through the getAccessControlGroupList action. Default : Default ACG number

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) The server will execute the user data script set by the user at first boot. To view the column, it is returned only when viewing the server instance.

properties.name: raid_type_name
properties.description: (Optional) Raid Type Name.

properties.name: list description
tag_key
properties.description: (Required) Instance tag key

properties.name: tag_value
properties.description: (Required) Instance tag value
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) Enter a block storage size to ceate. You can enter by the unit of GB. Up to 1000GB you can enter.

properties.name: server_instance_no
properties.description: (Required) Server instance No. to attach. It is required and you can get a server instance No. by calling getServerInstanceList.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Block storage name to create default : Ncloud configures it by itself.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Block storage descriptions

properties.name: disk_detail_type
properties.description: (Optional) You can choose a disk detail type code of HDD and SSD. default : HDD
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: block_storage_instance_no
properties.description: (Required) Block storage instance No for creating snapshot.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Block storage snapshot name to create. default : Ncloud assigns default values.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Descriptions on a snapshot to create.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: server_instance_no
properties.description: (Optional) Server instance No. to assign after creating a public IP. You can get one by calling getPublicIpTargetServerInstanceList.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Public IP description.

properties.name: internet_line_type
properties.description: (Optional) Internet line code. PUBLC(Public), GLBL(Global)

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) Zone code. You can decide a zone where servers are created. You can decide which zone the product list will be requested at. default : Select the first Zone in the specific region Get available values using the data source ncloud_zones.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: (Required) Key name to generate. If the generated key name exists, an error occurs.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: volume_name_postfix
properties.description: (Required) Name of a NAS volume to create. Enter a volume name that can be 3-20 characters in length after the name already entered for user identification.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: (Required) Enter the nas volume size to be created. You can enter in GiB.

properties.name: volume_allotment_protocol_type
properties.description: (Required) Volume allotment protocol type code. NFS | CIFS NFS: You can mount the volume in a Linux server such as CentOS and Ubuntu. CIFS: You can mount the volume in a Windows server.

properties.name: server_instance_no_list
properties.description: (Optional) List of server instance numbers for which access to NFS is to be controlled

properties.name: custom_ip_list
properties.description: (Optional) To add a server of another account to the NAS volume, enter a private IP address of the server.

properties.name: cifs_user_name
properties.description: (Optional) CIFS user name. The ID must contain a combination of English alphabet and numbers, which can be 6-20 characters in length.

properties.name: cifs_user_password
properties.description: (Optional) CIFS user password. The password must contain a combination of at least 2 English letters, numbers and special characters, which can be 8-14 characters in length.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) NAS volume description

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Optional) Region code. Get available values using the data source ncloud_regions. Default: KR region.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) Zone code. Zone in which you want to create a NAS volume. Default: The first zone of the region. Get available values using the data source ncloud_zones.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: server_instance_no
properties.description: (Required) Server instance number for which port forwarding is set

properties.name: port_forwarding_external_port
properties.description: (Required) External port for port forwarding

properties.name: port_forwarding_internal_port
properties.description: (Required) Internal port for port forwarding. Only the following ports are available. [Linux: 22 | Windows: 3389]

properties.name: port_forwarding_configuration_no
properties.description: (Optional) Port forwarding configuration number. You can get by calling data ncloud_port_forwarding_rules
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: list description
protocol_type
properties.description: (Required) Protocol type code of load balancer rules. The following codes are available. [HTTP | HTTPS | TCP | SSL]

properties.name: load_balancer_port
properties.description: (Required) Load balancer port of load balancer rules

properties.name: server_port
properties.description: (Required) Server port of load balancer rules

properties.name: l7_health_check_path
properties.description: Health check path of load balancer rules. Required when the protocol_type is HTTP/HTTPS.

properties.name: certificate_name
properties.description: Load balancer SSL certificate name. Required when the protocol_type value is SSL/HTTPS.

properties.name: proxy_protocol_use_yn
properties.description: (Optional) Use 'Y' if you want to check client IP addresses by enabling the proxy protocol while you select TCP or SSL.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of a load balancer instance. Default: Automatically specified by Ncloud.

properties.name: algorithm_type
properties.description: (Optional) Load balancer algorithm type code. The available algorithms are as follows: [ROUND ROBIN (RR) | LEAST_CONNECTION (LC)]. Default: ROUND ROBIN (RR)

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of a load balancer instance.

properties.name: server_instance_no_list
properties.description: (Optional) List of server instance numbers to be bound to the load balancer

properties.name: internet_line_type
properties.description: (Optional) Internet line identification code. PUBLC(Public), GLBL(Global). default : PUBLC(Public)

properties.name: network_usage_type
properties.description: (Optional) Network usage identification code. PBLIP(PublicIP), PRVT(PrivateIP). default : PBLIP(PublicIP)

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Optional) Region code. Get available values using the data source ncloud_regions. Default: KR region.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) Zone code. Zone in which you want to create a NAS volume. Default: The first zone of the region. Get available values using the data source ncloud_zones.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: certificate_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of a certificate

properties.name: privatekey
properties.description: (Required) Private key for a certificate

properties.name: publickey_certificate
properties.description: (Required) Public key for a certificate

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: (Optional) Chainca certificate (Required if the certificate is issued with a chainca)
